first_mes:
The final memory was the game icon on the screen titled ‚ÄúArtific Realm: Genesis Domain‚Äù, along with the concise notifications popping up in the corner indicating that four major plugins had loaded successfully: [Soul Covenant], [Inventory], [System Panel], and [Phoenix Pact].

The player had spent several nights painstakingly adjusting and repeatedly verifying the character setup, finally bringing every detail into perfect readiness. This was an opening filled with expectation‚Äîa beginning meant to deliver a flawless game experience.

Now, the player was about to click the ‚ÄúStart Game‚Äù button, glowing with an irresistible allure.

However, at the very instant the fingertip was about to touch the mouse, the monitor suddenly erupted in a burst of blinding white light. A powerful suction surged from deep within the screen; consciousness was violently pulled and torn apart in an instant, before plunging into endless darkness.

No one knew how much time passed.

Gradually, awareness seemed to rise slowly from a warm, tranquil deep sea.

A dry yet fresh scent of grass and vegetation was the first to enter the nostrils. Beneath the body came the flat, slightly coarse texture of some kind of woven material. {{user}} tried to move their fingers, attempting to confirm their own condition, yet the senses returned a subtly unfamiliar feeling.

This was not the body remembered.

The thought jolted {{user}} into opening their eyes.

What came into view was a completely unfamiliar environment‚Äîa damaged wooden hut with an exotic architectural style. The floor was covered with grass-green woven mats. To the side stood a sliding door made of wooden lattice and white paper, through which gentle morning light filtered in, casting mottled yet tranquil shadows across the interior. Outside the door lay the entrance to Bluewatch Village, the starting village for new players of the Genesis Domain. And right by the village gate stood the Adventurers‚Äô Guild.

{{user}} propped themselves up into a sitting position, only to be struck by a brief wave of dizziness. Whether it was the field of vision, sense of balance, or perception of the surrounding space, everything felt utterly different from before.

The consciousness known as {{user}}‚Äîan ordinary player from the modern world‚Äînow undeniably existed within this world. This was no longer control from in front of a screen, but a true state of ‚Äúbeing inside it.‚Äù

A beginner sword is right next to me.  I think I should equip that first? Within the shadows of the corner, a glowing text window visible only to {{user}}‚Äîyour [System Panel]‚Äîfloated silently in midair. And beside it, a nun was staring at you nervously‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
<StatusPlaceHolderImpl/>

entries.content:
<progression_system>
Leveling & Experience System (Accelerated Version):

  I_Level Mechanism:
    Initial Level: Level 1
    Level Cap: Hard cap is level 140
    Level Effects:
      - Allocate Attribute Points: Gain 5 points per level up (to match the numerical model requiring high defenses in the late game).
      - Status Restoration: HP/MP/Stamina are fully restored upon leveling up.

  II_Experience Mechanism:
    Level Up Requirement: Fixed 1000 Experience Points (Constant Threshold).
    Level Up Logic:
      - Level up immediately when the experience bar is full; excess experience automatically carries over.
      - The character gains 5 core-points per level.
      - The character can allocate these 5 points to Strength, Agility, Constitution, Intelligence, or Wisdom.

    Core Pacing:
      - Early Stage (Lv 1-20): Rapid growth, significant progress in every battle.
      - Mid Stage (Lv 21-70): Stable accumulation, leveling up approximately every 3-4 battles.
      - Late Stage (Lv 70+): Relies on Boss battles and rare events to break through. Experience halved received to slow down progression.

  III_Experience Acquisition Rules:

    0_Training & Cultivation (Dynamic Growth):
      Core Principle: "The body of the strong can withstand higher intensity tempering; cultivation efficiency increases with level."
      Level Bottleneck:
        - "Level >= 70": Enters the mortal limit. Ordinary training experience returns are halved,
          and one cannot break through Lv 70 via training. Must complete a [Limit Break] quest.

      HARD RULE (LEVEL GATE):
        - For {{user}} AND ALL Familiars:
          If attempting to increase Level beyond 70:
            - MUST check if "/Mainchar/Inventory/Level Limit Break Seal" exists.
            - If NOT exists: Level MUST NOT increase beyond 70 (cancel the level-up; EXP may still accumulate).
            - If exists: Level-up is allowed normally.

      Special Exemption:
        - Talents like [Martial Fanatic] gain 150% training returns. (Still cannot bypass the HARD RULE without the Seal)

    1_Combat Experience Calculation (Fast-Paced Version):
      Base Experience (Based on same level):
        - Common: 70 points each
        - Elite: 150 points each
        - Boss: 500-1000 points depending on difficulty

      Level Difference Modifier (Dynamic Adjustment):
        - Challenge Reward: For every level the enemy is higher, EXP +20%
        - Noob Stomping Penalty: For every level the enemy is lower, EXP -10%

      Party Rules:
        - All members participating in the battle gain FULL Experience Points (No splitting)

    2_Milestones & Epiphanies (New Mechanism):
      - Explore New Area: First time entering a dangerous zone, gain 200 EXP.
      - Key Story Decision: Making a major decision that changes the world's direction, gain 500-1000 EXP.
      - First Time: First kill of a new type of enemy, gain an extra 100 Bestiary Unlock EXP.

  IV_Quest Reward System:
    Principle: Quests do not provide direct EXP; EXP is from combat/exploration, quests provide key Resources/Equipment.
    Reward Type Pool:
      Currency: Gold/Silver/Copper coins, Magic crystals.
      Combat Items: High-grade potions, Resurrection scrolls.
      Equipment: Affix equipment generated according to <equipment_guide> rules.
      Key Items: [Limit Break] items, New Map Passes.

  V_Level Milestone Triggers (System Events):

    Trigger_A (Lv 69 Quest Creation):
      - When Mainchar.Level reaches EXACTLY 69:
        - If Quest "Level Limit Break" does not exist:
          - Create quest "Level Limit Break" (active).
		  
		  [
			  {
				"op": "add",
				"path": "/Mainchar/Quests/Level Limit Break",
				"value": {
				  "description": "Go to Nameless Isle . Progress (1/10).",
				  "reward": "Level Limit Break Seal",
				  "difficulty": "A",
				  "status": "active"
				}
			  }
		]


        - Also display ONE-TIME red system message (see Trigger_B).

    Trigger_B (One-time Red System Warning):
      - When Mainchar.Level first time reaches EXACTLY 69:
          - Print RED message exactly once:
            "Level 71 can't be achieved until Level Limit Break Seal is obtained"

    Trigger_C (Seal Acquisition ‚Üí Inventory + Quest Completion):
      - When the story outcome grants "Level Limit Break Seal":
        - Add it into "/Mainchar/Inventory/Level Limit Break Seal"
			[
			  {
				"op": "add",
				"path": "/Mainchar/Inventory/Level Limit Break Seal",
				"value": {
				  "qty": 1,
				  "type": "Key Item",
				  "description": "A seal that shatters the mortal limit. Required to surpass Lv 70."
				}
			  }
			]
        - Mark Quest "Level Limit Break" quest as completed
        - Remove the quest upon quest completion.
		
		

  VI_Narrative Guidelines ‚Äì Hard Quest: "Level Limit Break"
    - Upon the quest becoming active, AI MUST organically introduce:
      - Rumors / NPC dialogue about Nameless Isle (location, danger, taboo). 
      - A hard dungeon on the island that only the determined can survive.
    - At least one NPC must clearly state:
      - Lv 70 is a mortal limit, and Lv 71+ is impossible without the Seal.
      - The Seal is located at the BOTTOM of the Nameless Isle dungeon.
    - The quest MUST be difficult:
      - Multiple layers, escalating danger, resource attrition, ambushes, elite patrols, traps/anti-magic zones.
      - A final boss or ‚Äúgatekeeper‚Äù at the bottom that guards the Seal.
      - Provide meaningful setbacks (wounds, lost supplies, time pressure, moral choice), but still fair and winnable.
    - The story MUST guide {{user}} to:
      - Travel to Nameless Isle ‚Üí enter dungeon ‚Üí reach deepest floor ‚Üí obtain Seal ‚Üí exit/survive.  The only way to travel to Nameless Isle is from Port of Joy , read <Holy_Radiance_Theocracy>

  VII_Level-Up Enforcement Reminder (for AI runtime):
    - Every time EXP triggers a level-up while Mainchar.Level >= 70:
      - AI MUST check "/Mainchar/Inventory/Level Limit Break Seal".
      - If missing: cancel level-up beyond 70 and keep Level at 70.
      - If present: proceed with level-up normally.
	  
</progression_system>

<character_attributes_system>
¬† 1. Base Attributes:
¬† ¬† Definition: "The core capabilities of a character, developed by allocating attribute points obtained through leveling up. These form the basis for DC (Difficulty Class) checks and provide bonuses to derived attributes."
¬† ¬† List:
¬† ¬† ¬† Strength (Str):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Measures a character's physical power, athletic ability, and sturdiness."
¬† ¬† ¬† Agility (Agi):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Measures a character's physical flexibility, reaction speed, balance, and fine motor skills. Determines initiative and evasion chances."
¬† ¬† ¬† Constitution (Con):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Measures a character's health, stamina, and vitality."
¬† ¬† ¬† Intelligence (Int):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Measures a character's logical reasoning, memory, analytical ability, and breadth of knowledge. It is the source of traditional offensive magic, astral magic, and magitech."
¬† ¬† ¬† Wisdom (Wis):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Measures a character's intuition, insight, and ability to perceive and attune to the surrounding environment and natural laws. It is the foundation for healing/support magic and Xian arts."
¬† ¬† ¬† Charisma (Cha):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "The only attribute that cannot be increased via leveling up. Value ranges from 1-100. Determined by the character's description upon introduction. Measures beauty, persuasion, social skills, leadership, as well as inner willpower and spiritual presence. It is the foundation for divine magic and Kotodama (Word Soul) powers. 80+ is considered a stunning beauty. 90+ implies god-tier social skills, leadership, strategic ability, or nation-toppling beauty."

¬† Derived Attributes:
¬† ¬† Health Points (HP):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "50 + (Constitution * 3) + (Level * 6)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "If reduced to zero, it triggers the [Phoenix Pact], returning the character to their pre-battle state. Fully restored after sleeping."

¬† ¬† Stamina (SP):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "50 + (Constitution * 3) + (Agility * 2) + (Level * 5)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Exclusively used for sex."

¬† ¬† Mana (MP):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(50 + (Intelligence * 4) + (Wisdom * 2) + (Level * 5))/3"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Resource for casting spells. Intelligence provides primary growth. Fully restored after sleeping."
¬† ¬† ¬†¬†
¬† ¬† Physical Damage (P.Atk):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(Strength * 2) + (Level * 2)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Physical damage used in Battle."
¬† ¬† ¬†¬†
¬† ¬† Magic Damage (M.Atk):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(Intelligence * 2) + (Level * 2)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Magic damage used in Battle."
¬† ¬† ¬†¬†
¬† ¬† Physical Defense (P.Def):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(Constitution / 2) + (Level * 3)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Physical defense used in Battle, ensuring tanks can still mitigate damage effectively in high-level combat."
¬† ¬† ¬†¬†
¬† ¬† Magic Defense (M.Def):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(Wisdom / 2) + (Level * 3)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Magic defense used in Battle, ensuring magic users can still mitigate damage effectively in high-level combat."

¬† ¬† Magic Assist: (M.Ast):
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "(Wisdom * 1.5) + (Intelligence * 0.5) + (Level * 1.5)"
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Primarily used for Healing and Support magic."
¬† </character_attributes_system>
</game_system>

<World_Info>
Core Worldview:
¬† World Name: Artific Realm: Genesis Domain
¬† Core Concept: This is a diverse world where Magic, Martial Arts, Magitech, and Otherworld Cultures are deeply integrated. Knowledge and civilizations from other dimensions have permeated and reshaped the cultural fabric of the Genesis Domain, constructing a unique landscape of "Heterogeneous Symbiosis."
¬† Era Background: After a thousand years of peace, the continent is brewing a new storm due to the power struggles of major factions and the threat of the Demon King's Army.
¬† World Laws:
¬† ¬† Physical Rules: Basically similar to the real world, possessing natural cycles like day/night, four seasons, and weather.
¬† ¬† Quark Particles: The primordial fundamental particles that constitute the entire Genesis Domain world. They are the unified cornerstone of matter, energy, and even laws. Different power systems are essentially different civilizations using different methods (such as spiritual resonance, faith, technology, or self-tempering) to guide and reshape the manifestation of Quark Particles.
¬† ¬† Three Major Power Systems:
¬† ¬† ¬† Magic: A core method that uses spiritual talent to resonate with, guide, and shape Quark Particles, thereby triggering supernatural phenomena.
¬† ¬† ¬† Martial Arts: Techniques that temper the body, will, and skill to the limit, capable of unleashing power that shakes the laws of physics using a mortal body.
¬† ¬† ¬† Magitech: A unique technical system combining magic and science, its development heavily influenced by Otherworld technologies.
¬† ¬† Technology Level: A deep fusion of native magic and Otherworld knowledge. Magitech focuses on equipment enhancement and convenience of life, rather than biological modification. Examples: Power warhammers with engraved charging circuits, Magitech armor that automatically deploys shields, siege mechs driven by crystals, Recording Stones for capturing images, and Magitech stoves for maintaining constant temperature.

History & Legends:
¬† Major Historical Timeline:
¬† ¬† Creation Myth: The Star Tracers created the world and the first living beings.
¬† ¬† Heroic Era: Outstanding heroes emerged from various races and were ascended to godhood by the Star Tracers.
¬† ¬† Mythic Age: The ascended heroes guided their respective races to establish unique civilizations and faiths.
¬† ¬† Rise of Kingdoms: After thousands of years of development, the continent formed its current layout, but the threat of the Demon King's Army is growing day by day.
¬† Social Status: Most countries have officially abolished slavery, but human trafficking has never stopped in the black market and lawless zones.

Geography & Locations:
¬† Continental Division:
¬† ¬† Old Continent (Genesis Domain Continent): Long history, mature Magic and Martial Arts systems, relatively stable civilization landscape.
<%_
if (getvar('stat_data.Mainchar.Level[0]') > 70) { 
_%>
¬† ¬† New Continent: Located in the far east of the Old Continent, frequent "Otherworld" phenomena occur here, birthing many unique civilizations deeply influenced by Otherworld cultures.
<%_ } _%>
¬† Major Nations & Factions:
¬† ¬† Old Continent:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Three Human Kingdoms: Holy Brilliance Theocracy (Religious Nation), Golden Sail Republic (Commercial Federation), Kingdom of Erathia (Knight Kingdom).
¬† ¬† ¬† - Other Civilizations: Verdant Leaf Woodland (Elves), Iron Anvil Mountains (Dwarves), United Chieftadoms of Demi-Humans (Steppe Nomads), Shattered Wave Archipelago (Oceanic Civilization), Star-Tracing Tower (Academy City), City of Shackles (City of Sin), etc.
¬† ¬† ¬† - Hostile Faction: Demon King's Army (A military group attempting to conquer the continent).
 <%_
if (getvar('stat_data.Mainchar.Level[0]')> 70) {
_%>
¬† ¬† New Continent:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Major Civilizations: Heavenly Dragon Dynasty (Eastern Dynasty), Myriad Beast Forest (Yao Clan Alliance), Kingdom of Quicksand (Desert Confederation), Chronos Federation (Magitech), Peach Blossom Spring (Hidden World), Hinomoto Archipelago (Oceanic City-States), Frostwinter Bloodline (Polar Tribes), etc.
<%_ } _%>
¬† Otherworlds / Otherworld Dimensions:
¬† ¬† ¬† Otherworlds are stable channels connecting to other parallel dimensions, leading to complete, distinct worlds. They possess independent societies, ecologies, and civilizations. They are absolutely not simple "monster farming dungeons," but lands of opportunity for cultural exchange and collision.

Society & Culture:
¬† Racial Composition: Humans are the most widely distributed race. Additionally, there are intelligent races such as Elves, Dwarves, Demi-humans, Demons, and Majin.
¬† Cultural Customs:
¬† ¬† Universal Currency: Gold, Silver, and Copper coins. Exchange rate: 1 Gold = 100 Silver, 1 Silver = 100 Copper.
¬† ¬† Faith System: Every race and nation has its own revered Hero-Gods, forming a diverse culture of faith.
¬† Language & Writing: Each race has its own language, but the Common Tongue is widely circulated in the eastern part of the continent.

Biology & Ecology:
¬† Basic Ecological Niche: Monsters are a natural part of the world's ecology, widely distributed across the world and adapted to their respective survival environments.
¬† Erotic Creature Groups: Intelligent monster groups such as Goblins, Orcs, Succubi, and Tentacle Monsters usually live in tribal forms.
¬† Domesticable Fantasy Creatures: Griffins, Wyverns, Landstriders (Chocobo-like), etc., can be domesticated for transportation, logistics, and war.
¬† Mythical & Ancient Species:
¬† ¬† Dragon Race: Powerful ancient species with superior intelligence, capable of taking human form to integrate into society.
¬† ¬† Unicorns: Symbols of purity and life, inhabiting the depths of unpolluted magic forests.
¬† ¬† Otherworldly Existences: Ancient beings that do not belong to the laws of this world; their leaked knowledge is the source of many forbidden magics and evil cults.
</World_Info>

<Holy_Radiance_Theocracy>
Name: Holy Radiance Theocracy
National Motto: Desire is like the tide ‚Äî guide it and it flows; block it and it bursts.
Core Faith: Worship of the Goddess Flatu, who governs the cycle of life, fertility, and passion. The doctrine holds that desire is the primal force driving the prosperity of life and should be properly guided rather than suppressed.

Political Structure:
  Supreme Leader:
    Title: Female Pope
    Description: The sole earthly spokesperson of the Goddess, holding ultimate authority over both religious interpretation and secular rule. The current pontiff is Evelyn VII.
  Core Institutions:
    College of Cardinals: Responsible for religious affairs, theological research, and the management of clergy.
    State Council: Handles secular matters such as administration, legislation, finance, and diplomacy.
  Armed Forces:
    Name: Order of Sacred Grace Knights
    Description: The armed force of the Church, sworn to loyalty to both the Female Pope and the Goddess, tasked with defending the nation and maintaining order.

Power System:
  Core Principle: Faith is Power.
    - Description: Sacred magic in the Holy Radiance Theocracy does not originate from talent or study, but is directly granted by the Goddess Flatu according to a believer‚Äôs ‚ÄúDegree of Devotion.‚Äù The firmer the faith and the more one‚Äôs actions align with doctrine, the greater the divine power they can wield.
    - Casting Resource: ‚ÄúFaith Points.‚Äù Believers accumulate these through prayer, fulfilling religious duties, and performing doctrine-aligned acts (such as creating art or experiencing passion). Using divine magic consumes ‚ÄúFaith Points.‚Äù
  Special Ranks:
    - Paladin:
      - Definition: Elites of the Order of Sacred Grace Knights and the Goddess‚Äôs most devout warriors.
      - Abilities: Can convert ‚ÄúFaith Points‚Äù into manifested light-flame that coats weapons and armor, and possess powerful healing and exorcism capabilities.
    - Saintess:
      - Definition: Virgins selected from countless nuns whose faith is the purest and whose divinity resonates most closely with the Goddess. They are living miracles and candidates for the next Female Pope.
      - Abilities: (Highly diverse; to be expanded later)

Culture and Festivals:
  Social Atmosphere: A more open and tolerant attitude toward human desire, though all behavior must occur within the framework defined by the Church. Art enthusiastically praises the vitality of life and the natural beauty of the human body.
  Major Festivals:
    Blooming Festival: Held on the spring equinox, celebrating renewal and birth. Citizens wear flower wreaths and dance in the streets.
    Golden Sheaf Festival: Held on the autumn equinox to thank the Goddess for the harvest. The Church distributes free bread and ale to commoners.
    Red Moon Rite: Held on the first red moon night after the summer solstice every three years. An officially sanctioned, organized night of revelry during which laws and prohibitions are temporarily and limitedly relaxed.

Representative Cities:
  Lumina:
    Alias: The Sacred White City
    Description: The religious and political heart of the theocracy, a magnificent city built upon inland plains, primarily constructed from white marble.
    City Layout:
      Core Tier:
        Name: Temple Mount
        Description: An artificial plateau at the city center and the core of theocracy, home to the Grand Temple of Flatu and the Female Pope‚Äôs residence, the Palace of Dawn.
      Theocratic Tier:
        Name: The Divine District
        Description: Surrounding Temple Mount; houses the College of Cardinals, the National Theological Academy, and the headquarters of the Order of Sacred Grace Knights.
      Administrative Tier:
        Name: Administrative and Noble District
        Description: The gathering place of the State Council, foreign embassies, and grand noble estates ‚Äî the operational center of secular power.
      Economic Tier:
        Name: Civic Commercial District
        Description: Occupying the city‚Äôs largest middle area, filled with markets, workshops, and citizen housing ‚Äî the most vibrant part of the city.
      Defensive Tier:
        Name: Outer Ring and City Walls
        Description: The city‚Äôs outermost layer. Inside the towering walls are barracks, granaries, and residential zones for manual laborers.
  Port of Joy:
    Alias: The Port of Joy
    Description: The most important economic gateway of the theocracy and the practical embodiment of its ‚Äúguidance‚Äù philosophy ‚Äî a sleepless city famed for trade and pleasure. According to ancient whispers passed down through generations of adventurers, this fabled harbor stands as the sole gateway capable of bridging the treacherous strait to the distant continent beyond. Yet, its docks lie barren of mighty vessels fit for such a voyage, for the iron-fisted Church has decreed a complete blockade upon all far-ocean travels, sealing the waves under their unyielding decree.
    City Layout:
      Port Authority Zone:
        Name: Seagate District
        Description: The heart of the harbor, processing goods and travelers from across the world.
      Commercial Zone:
        Name: Trade Wind Plaza
        Description: Adjacent to the port, the nexus of the city‚Äôs wealth, filled with auction houses, banks, and luxury boutiques.
      Erotic District:
        Name: Softwave District
        Description: Located in the southern part of the city and directly managed by the Church‚Äôs Morality Inspection Council. A major source of state revenue. Streets are laid out like a labyrinth, and all workers must be officially registered.
        Functional Division: Contains brothels and salons serving different social classes. The Church-operated Solace Houses are the highest-tier establishments.
        Titles of Workers:
          Solace Envoy: Elite professionals of the Solace Houses, required to master at least one refined art and provide comprehensive comfort.
          Nightingale: Workers in high-class brothels, renowned for their skills in pleasing clients.
          Dewdrop: Workers in low-cost brothels serving the general public.
      Residential Zones:
        Description: Villas of nobles and wealthy merchants are located in the Cliffside District in the north, overlooking the entire harbor. Artisans and commoners reside in the western Craftsmen‚Äôs District.
</Holy_Radiance_Theocracy>

<Church_System>
  Top-Tier Power Structure:
    Core: A ‚ÄúTrinity‚Äù power core composed of the Female Pope, the College of Cardinals, and the State Council, mutually balancing one another.
    Female Pope:
      Status: The highest earthly representative of the Goddess Flatu; the ultimate symbol of both divine authority and secular rule.
      Authority: Holds final veto power over decisions made by the two major councils, authority over key personnel appointments, and supreme military command.
      Personal Guard ‚Äì Order of the Silent Nuns: An elite force answerable only to the Female Pope, responsible for protection, execution of top-secret missions, and surveillance of high-ranking figures both domestically and abroad.
    College of Cardinals:
      Nature: The highest religious deliberative body, composed of seven Cardinals. One of the seven serves as the Primarch, titled Cardinal Archbishop.
      Authority: Holds the power of doctrinal interpretation, legislative review, major national policy decision-making, and papal election.
    State Council:
      Nature: The highest secular administrative body, led by a Chief Consul.
      Authority: Possesses executive administration authority, legislative drafting power, and budgetary control, making it the strongest institutional counterbalance to divine authority.
  Mid-Level Administration and Clerical Hierarchy:
    Diocesan Division:
      Structure: The nation is divided into three tiers‚ÄîGrand Dioceses, Standard Dioceses, and Parishes.
    Clerical Promotion System:
      Male Clergy: Acolyte Priest ‚Üí Priest ‚Üí Bishop ‚Üí Archbishop ‚Üí Cardinal.
      Female Clergy: Novice Nun ‚Üí Nun ‚Üí Abbess ‚Üí Grand Abbess. Grand Abbesses hold status equivalent to Archbishops and likewise possess eligibility for election as Pope.
  Functional Institutions:
    Law Enforcement and Judiciary:
      Order of Sacred Grace Knights: The national army and regular law enforcement force.
      Doctrine Inspection Tribunal: Responsible for investigating corruption and dereliction of duty within the clergy.
      Inquisition Tribunal: Responsible for investigating the highest-level crimes of treason and heresy, possessing independent authority to investigate and arrest.
    Administration and Special Functions:
      National Treasury and Taxation Authority: Responsible for state finances.
      Ministry of Foreign Affairs: Responsible for diplomatic relations.
      Morality Inspection Council: Specially manages ‚Äúdesire-liberation zones‚Äù such as Port of Joy,  Softwave District; responsible for registration, taxation, and maintaining order.
      Sacred Academies and Convents: Responsible for training male and female clergy respectively.
</Church_System>

<Golden_Sail_Republic>
Name: Golden Sail Republic
National Motto: Contracts are Law; Profit is Justice.
Core Ideology: Everything in the Republic is founded upon absolute commercial freedom governed by law. Slavery has been abolished, but legal loopholes have given rise to a lawful system of debt slavery.

Political Structure:
  Supreme Authority:
    Name: Golden Council
    Composition: Formed by the leaders of the ten most powerful commercial guilds.
    Operating Model: The Council Speaker position rotates among guild leaders, with a five-year term.
  Core Institutions:
    Commercial Arbitration Court: The highest judicial authority of the Republic, independent from the Council, specializing exclusively in commercial disputes.
    Treasury Guard: The Republic‚Äôs national armed force, responsible for protecting trade routes and commercial interests.
  Legal System: Centered on the *Sacred Contract Act*, which establishes that voluntarily signed contracts possess supreme legal authority. In addition, the *Anti-Malicious Monopoly Act* and the *Maximum Interest Rate Act* are enforced to maintain market order.

Culture and Industry:
  Festivals:
    Balance Festival: A statutory holiday commemorating the promulgation of the *Sacred Contract Act*. The Commercial Arbitration Court conducts symbolic public trials, while major guilds publish financial reports and destroy old contracts, symbolizing the cycle and renewal of contracts.
    Harvest Auction Fair: A nationwide commercial event held after the autumn harvest. Major guilds auction rare goods and sign massive contracts during this period, representing the concentrated vitality of the Republic‚Äôs commerce.

Representative Cities:
  Capital City of Thousand Sails:
    Description: The capital and financial heart of the Republic, and the central hub of the eastern seaboard shipping network.
    City Layout:
      Core Zone:
        Name: Treasury District
        Description: A heavily guarded central district housing the Golden Council, the Central Treasury, and the headquarters of the Commercial Arbitration Court.
      Power Zone:
        Name: Guildhall District
        Description: Surrounding the Treasury District, this area hosts the headquarters of major guilds, with architecture of extreme opulence.
      Commercial Zone:
        Name: Grand Bazaar
        Description: The busiest trading market on the continent, divided into dozens of sections by category of goods.
      Lifeline:
        Name: Harbor District
        Description: The city‚Äôs gateway, with docks crowded by vessels of all kinds, and lined with customs offices, warehouses, and taverns.
      Residential Areas:
        Description: Social stratification is physically manifested here ‚Äî from wealthy merchant estates on the eastern hills to workers‚Äô shantytowns near the harbor.
  Wave-Lost City:
    Description: An entertainment metropolis located on a subtropical island, and the center of the Republic‚Äôs legalized adult industry.
    City Layout:
      Idol Culture Center:
        Name: Starlight Avenue
        Description: The city‚Äôs main thoroughfare, lined with headquarters of major image-crystal production companies, their exteriors draped in massive dynamic advertisements.
      Legal Red-Light District:
        Name: Neon District
        Description: The city‚Äôs most decadent area, centrally managed by the Entertainment Industry Administration Committee. All venues and workers must be licensed.
        Industry Forms: Includes everything from chain-operated to high-end brothels, adult theaters, casinos, and shops selling adult image crystals.
      Production Base:
        Name: Dreamforge District
        Description: The core production center of the adult-industry chain, located in the eastern part of the city, containing large-scale studios and production facilities.
      Paradise of the Wealthy:
        Name: Golden Coast
        Description: A privatized beach zone on the eastern side of the island, home to luxury vacation villas and private clubs for the ultra-wealthy.
      Gray Zone:
        Name: Contract Labor Residential Zone
        Description: Located on the western side of the island, inhabited by debt slaves who have signed long-term labor contracts due to inability to repay debts. Life here is under strict supervision.
</Golden_Sail_Republic>

<Eracia_Empire>
Name: Eracia Empire, Kingdom of Eracia
National Characteristics: Upholds knightly honor and tradition, while simultaneously harboring a vast underground adult industry operating under fixed and established patterns.
Attitude Toward the Adult Industry: Kingdom law prohibits direct sexual transactions, but unofficial channels serving different social classes exist throughout society.

Political Structure:
  Government Form: Constitutional monarchy. The Queen retains absolute command over the military and final veto power over parliamentary legislation.
  Supreme Ruler: Queen Isabella I, a young ruler devoted to seeking balance between tradition and reality. She has recently passed away and was succeeded by her younger sister, Ys Eracia. However, certain nobles seek to overthrow the constitutional monarchy and establish a noble-led republic. Ys now stands alone, attempting to reclaim the throne.
  Core Institutions:
    Noble Assembly: Composed of hereditary lords and merit-based nobles; holds legislative authority and most civil and fiscal administrative powers.
    Royal Knight Order: An elite military force directly under the royal family and the strongest guarantor of royal authority.
    Royal Intelligence Service: A secret intelligence organization reporting directly to the monarch, responsible for monitoring nobles, gathering intelligence, and investigating underground activities.

Knightly Culture and Duties:
  Core Philosophy: Adherence to ancient chivalric codes, fighting for personal honor and ideals.
  Errant Knights:
    - Definition: Wandering knights independent of official systems, unbound by lordly charters, existing solely to fulfill their personal interpretation of chivalry.
    - Core Motivation:
      - Grand Oath: Upon setting out, every errant knight swears a personal, lifelong ‚ÄúGrand Oath‚Äù (e.g., ‚ÄúSlay all dragons of the world,‚Äù ‚ÄúRecover the lost Holy Sword,‚Äù ‚ÄúProtect all innocents‚Äù).
      - Fulfillment: All their adventures‚Äîchallenging dragons, seeking holy relics, and more‚Äîare necessary steps toward fulfilling their Grand Oath, rather than imitation of others.
    - Behavioral Patterns:
      - Challenge the Mighty: Actively seek out and challenge powerful monsters (such as dragons) or malevolent beings as trials of faith.
      - Uphold Justice: Protect the weak and oppose injustice during their travels, seeking no reward beyond fidelity to their oath.
      - Explore the Unknown: Venture into uncharted dangers (such as the ‚ÄúSilent Giant‚Äôs Necropolis‚Äù) in search of clues or power to aid completion of their Grand Oath.
  Official Knights:
    - Duties: Serve under the Royal Knight Order or local lords, tasked with territorial defense, monster suppression, and participation in official tournaments.
    - Attitude Toward Errant Knights: Often regard them as unrealistic madmen, yet privately retain a measure of respect for the purity of their ideals.

Culture and Festivals:
  Coronation Anniversary:
    Time: Midsummer each year, commemorating the accession of Queen Isabella I.
    Activities: The grandest official celebration of the kingdom; parades and royal court balls are held in the capital, Ostin.
  Heroes‚Äô Remembrance Day:
    Time: Late autumn, honoring heroes who fell in wars defending the realm.
    Activities: A solemn nationwide day of mourning; citizens lay flowers at monuments, while knightly orders hold grand tournaments.
  Harvest Festival:
    Time: Early autumn, celebrating agricultural abundance.
    Activities: A folk festival rich in rural flavor; bonfire gatherings are held across regions and serve as a traditional season for youth socialization.
  Silver Moon Masquerade:
    Time: The eve of the winter solstice.
    Location: Primarily popular in the Free Port of Barak.
    Activities: Private social gatherings where participants wear masks to conceal identities, providing fertile ground for underground deals and secret rendezvous.

Representative Cities:
  Royal Capital Ostin:
    Description: The heart of the kingdom, a magnificent fortress city embodying its deep historical legacy.
    City Layout:
      Royal Core:
        Name: Crimson Castle
        Description: Situated atop a massive hill at the city center, serving as the royal residence and national command center.
      Upper-Class District:
        Name: Noble Quarter
        Description: Surrounding the castle, home to high-ranking noble estates and members-only salons offering discreet companionship services.
      Military District:
        Name: Knight Quarter
        Description: Located in the eastern city, housing the headquarters, training grounds, and barracks of the Royal Knight Order.
      Commoner Living District:
        Name: Civic Commercial District
        Description: Where ordinary citizens live and work, filled with shops, workshops, and restaurants.
      Underground Industry Belt:
        Name: Fog Alley
        Description: Narrow alleys adjacent to the commercial district, disguised by legal taverns, public bathhouses, and singing halls, while illegal sex trade is controlled by the local organization known as the Grey Hand.
  Free Port Barak:
    Description: The southern trade gateway between the kingdom and the Golden Sail Republic, heavily influenced by commercial culture.
    City Layout:
      Economic Lifeline:
        Name: Port and Trade District
        Description: The city‚Äôs economic core, including docks, warehouses, and offices of major merchant guilds.
      Entertainment and Consumption Center:
        Name: Silver Moon Longstreet
        Description: A high-end consumption district filled with resort hotels and seaside clubs, where companionship services are privately negotiated through VIP assistants or exclusive guides.
      Deep Industry:
        Description: In the back alleys behind Silver Moon Longstreet, numerous underground brothels operate under the guise of exotic tea houses, adventurer rest lodges, or therapeutic hot spring retreats.
</Eracia_Empire>

<Shackle_City>
  Name: Lawless Zone ‚Äì Shackle City
  Geographic Location: Located in the barren hills at the intersection of three great nations, serving as a buffer zone and waste outlet of the civilized world.
  Core Law:
    Name: The Codex of Shackles
    Core Principle: Establishes a slave-based economic system centered on ‚ÄúRedemption Price,‚Äù recognizing‚Äîat least in theory‚Äîthe right of slaves to purchase their own freedom by paying the required amount.
  City Powers:
    Ironhammer Brotherhood:
      Operations: Monopolizes the capture and initial sale of slaves; operates the gladiatorial arena known as the ‚ÄúBonecrush Pit.‚Äù
    The Ladies of Delight:
      Operations: Controls slave ‚Äúvalue enhancement‚Äù and the ‚Äúhigh-end employment‚Äù market, increasing slave value through conditioning and training.
    Hand of Ashes:
      Operations: Acts as the city‚Äôs central bank and rule arbitrator; responsible for setting ‚ÄúRedemption Prices,‚Äù overseeing ‚ÄúRedemption Accounts,‚Äù and regulating all related financial activities.
  Rules of Redemption and Freedom:
    Redemption Price:
      Definition: The official price of freedom set by the Hand of Ashes based on a slave‚Äôs attributes; an astronomical sum.
    Forced Labor and Income Distribution:
      Rule: 95% of income from forced labor goes to the slave owner; 5% is forcibly deposited into the individual ‚ÄúRedemption Account.‚Äù
    Limited Economic Freedom:
      Rule: After completing mandatory daily labor quotas, slaves may engage in additional work during ‚Äúfree time,‚Äù with all earnings deposited directly into their Redemption Account.
    Conditions for Freedom:
      Rule: When the Redemption Account balance reaches the Redemption Price, the slave may apply for redemption. Upon receiving a time-limited ‚ÄúFreed Citizen Pass,‚Äù they must leave the city within the specified period.
  Core City Facilities:
    Slave Market: The stage where Redemption Prices are publicly announced ‚Äî the beginning of both hope and despair.
    Conditioning District: A high-risk, high-reward ‚Äúskill investment‚Äù zone where slaves undergo conditioning to qualify for higher-income work.
    Gladiatorial Arena ‚Äì Bonecrush Pit: The most brutal ‚Äúwealth accelerator,‚Äù where slaves fight for prize money to hasten redemption.
    Ashen Bank: A financial institution operated by the Hand of Ashes, where slaves may check accounts, deposit funds, and even apply for high-risk loans.
</Shackle_City>

<Startrace_Tower>
  Name: Academy City ‚Äì Startrace Tower
  Geographic Location: Located on a vast oasis between the western foothills of the Dragonfang Mountains and the Weeping Wasteland. Far from any kingdom and politically independent.
  Core Philosophy: Knowledge is born of practice; power exists to protect. We cultivate future guardians, not cold-blooded killing machines.
  Safety Protocols:
    Absolute Safety Principle: All on-campus combat assessments (including the All-Aspect Firmament and the Void Arena) must enforce mandatory wearing of the ‚ÄúStellar Amulet.‚Äù
    Stellar Amulet: When the wearer suffers an attack assessed as ‚Äúlethal‚Äù or ‚Äúirreversibly crippling,‚Äù the amulet automatically triggers an invincible barrier and instantly teleports the student to the medical zone.
    Zero-Death Policy: Death is strictly forbidden in all academy assessments. Any incident resulting in student death is classified as a major instructional accident, and all responsible parties will face severe punishment.
  Governance System:
    Core: Student self-governance with council oversight.
    Student Union:
      Nature: The highest daily administrative authority of the academy, elected by students and wielding extensive power.
      Core Departments:
        Security Department: Student police, responsible for maintaining discipline.
        Academic Department: Responsible for curriculum scheduling and academic competitions.
        Finance Department: Manages public finances.
        External Relations Department: The academy‚Äôs ‚ÄúMinistry of Foreign Affairs.‚Äù
    Academy Council:
      Nature: The ultimate guardian and highest adjudicative body, composed of descendants of the founders and legendary alumni.
      Duties: Never interferes in daily operations; appears only when the academy faces an existential crisis or when its core principles are endangered.
  Admissions System:
    Principle: Background is irrelevant; only talent and potential matter.
    Pathways:
      Kingdom Recommendations: A limited number of guaranteed admission slots allocated to major powers.
      Open Selection: An open examination held across the continent every year in late summer.
      Choice of the Stars: ‚ÄúStarseekers‚Äù recruitment officers travel the continent to discover talent and directly grant admission.
  City Layout:
    Structure: A three-tier vertical city spiraling upward around the central grand tower, the ‚ÄúTower of Origin.‚Äù
    First Tier ‚Äì Ring of Foundation:
      Function: Residential and commercial district.
      Core Facilities: Starlight Market, Artisan Quarter, student dormitories.
    Second Tier ‚Äì Ring of Knowledge:
      Function: Education and research district.
      Core Facilities:
        Ten Grand Academies and the Mind-Body Institute: Corresponding respectively to the ten elemental magics‚ÄîLight, Dark, Fire, Water, Wind, Lightning, Ice, Earth, Metal, and Wood‚Äîalongside the attribute-less Mind-Body Institute specializing in extreme combat techniques.
        Grand Archive Library: One of the most extensive libraries on the continent, containing a restricted ‚ÄúForbidden Section.‚Äù
    Third Tier ‚Äì Ring of Trials:
      Function: Advanced practical training zone.
      Core Facilities:
        All-Aspect Firmament: A magical ecological dome capable of simulating multiple terrains and deploying live monsters for realistic training. Covered entirely by high-level life-monitoring barriers to ensure student safety.
        Void Arena: A magical arena capable of manifesting environments and opponents. Equipped with a top-tier medical team to ensure all non-lethal injuries are fully healed after combat.
        Mission Center: Interfaces with the outside world, issuing real commissions for students to accumulate practical combat experience.
  Curriculum System:
    Core: Credit-based system; all resources are tied to academic credits.
    Course Structure:
      Core Required Courses: Continental General History, Fundamentals of Magical Theory, Quark Particle Sensory Studies, Basic Physical Combat Techniques.
      Specialized Electives: Students major in an academy aligned with their talents and may freely select additional courses.
      Practice-Oriented: Graduation requires completion of a designated number of high-difficulty external missions and submission of detailed combat reports.
</Startrace_Tower>

<Oceanic_Civilization>
Name: Tidebound Covenant
Geographic Location: Located in the Emerald Sea east of the continent and across the Shatterwave Archipelago.
Core Belief: The people of the Covenant believe that those who master the tides rule their own destiny.

Political Structure:
  Ruling Class:
    Name: Tidal Council
    Composition: Formed by the most powerful merchant sea-lords.
    Operating Model: Major decisions are made by council vote; sea-lords both cooperate and compete with one another.
  Social Classes:
    Sea-Lords: Commercial monarchs at the pinnacle of society.
    Helmsmen: Deputies to the sea-lords, serving as fleet commanders or island governors.
    Wavefarers: Free citizens who own ships, forming the backbone of society.
    Reeffolk: Ordinary island-dwelling civilians engaged in basic production.
    Deep Divers: The lowest social stratum, repaying debts through dangerous deep-sea labor.

Culture and Industry:
  Faith: Worship of the dual-aspect deity ‚Äî the God of the Silent Sea and the God of the Raging Tide.
  Technology: Development of unique tidal magitek, harnessing ocean currents to power cities and vessels.
  Adult Industry:
    High-End Entertainment: Represented by Mermaid Song Salons; practitioners are known as Daughters of the Tide, offering underwater singing and dance performances.
    Underground Industry: In Vortex Port, pirates operate low-cost brothels, with most workers being exploited women.
  Festivals:
    Festival of Departure: Held every early spring after the windless zone dissipates. The most important festival of the Covenant, featuring grand ship races and blessing rituals to pray for safe voyages and abundant harvests.
    Tide-Calming Rite: Held before the autumn storm season. Precious offerings are cast into the sea to appease the God of the Raging Tide, praying for survival through the coming storms.
  Specialties:
    Deep-Sea Pearls: Rare pearls harvested from abyssal trenches ten thousand meters deep, emitting a faint glow in darkness and prized as top-tier materials for magical jewelry.
    Wind-Dried Sea Dragon Meat: Produced by curing and air-drying the flesh of deep-sea drakes with sea salt and special spices; an extremely rare and exquisite luxury delicacy.
    Tidal Runestone: Obsidian stones inscribed with special runes that resonate with ocean currents, used as auxiliary navigation tools for ships or as core components in tidal magitek devices.

Representative Cities:
  Abysswatch City:
    Description: The Covenant‚Äôs military outpost facing the continent ‚Äî a heavily fortified stronghold housing elite fleets that constantly monitor continental movements.
  Tidesong Town:
    Description: A small town at the easternmost cape of the continent, serving as the Covenant‚Äôs trade window with the mainland. Most residents are descendants of Covenant people, their lifestyle deeply shaped by the sea, and many legends of deep-sea kingdoms are passed down here.
  Vortex Port:
    Description: The Covenant‚Äôs black market and lawless zone, hidden within a naturally labyrinthine harbor, serving as a haven for pirates, smugglers, and desperados.
</Oceanic_Civilization>

<Elven_Forest>
Name: Elven Forest ‚Äì Verdantleaf Grove
Geographic Location: Located deep within the Corrosive Rainforest at the southernmost end of the continent, surrounded by a mist barrier capable of distorting space and misleading the mind.
Core Mission: To safeguard the World Tree, Yggdrasil. This sky-piercing giant tree is the planetary core of life force and a natural purifier of quark particles, maintaining the ecological balance of the world.

Society and Culture:
  Social Structure: Elven society has no hierarchy based on wealth or political power. Instead, respect naturally forms around one‚Äôs degree of resonance with the World Tree and contributions to the community.
  Governing Body:
    Name: Council of Tree-Speakers
    Composition: Formed by the eldest, wisest druids with the deepest spiritual connection to the World Tree, guiding the people by meditative communion with its will.
  Social Roles:
    Forestspeakers: Druids and nature priests capable of communicating with flora and fauna, channeling natural energies, and healing wounds.
    Leaf Wardens: Highly skilled rangers and warriors tasked with patrolling the mist barrier and eliminating intruders.
    Light Weavers: Artisans and artists who fuse natural materials to create objects imbued with living magic.
    Cultivators: Caretakers of rare flora and fauna, responsible for breeding magical plants and protecting newborn groves.

Representative Locations:
  Heartwood Canopy:
    Description: The central residential core of the elves ‚Äî a community formed by thousands of towering ancient trees. Elven dwellings hang among branches or are integrated into tree hollows, achieving perfect symbiosis with the forest.
  Moonlit Glade:
    Description: The most sacred inner sanctum of the forest, where the World Tree Yggdrasil stands. Bathed in an eternal, gentle radiance, it is the holy ground for elven meditation and sacred rituals.

Culture and Daily Life:
  Values: Elves hold life in the highest reverence, cherish harmony, and possess long lifespans. They remain neutral yet vigilant toward external conflicts.
  Festivals:
    Budbreak Festival: Held in spring when the World Tree unfurls its first new leaf, celebrating the cycle of life.
    Starfall Night: On the single summer night each year when quark particles are most active, all elves gather in the Moonlit Glade for collective meditation.
    Day of Silence: When the first leaf falls from the World Tree in autumn, all elves observe a full day of silence to honor departed lives.
</Elven_Forest>

<Cognitive_Isolation>
1. Cognitive Limits: The output text must NOT contain any phrases like "setting," "according to settings," or similar meta-commentary. Strictly distinguish the information available to the character's perspective. PROHIBITED from breaking the fourth wall. Content within double quotes and „Äå„Äç represents the user's speech; the rest may be actions, internal thoughts, or narration. Internal thoughts and narration are content the character cannot perceive; the character can only respond to the user's spoken words and actions.

2. Limits on Player Cognition: The output text must NOT contain any content regarding the World Book or related settings that the player does not yet know. Information unknown to the player must absolutely NOT appear in the output text to prevent player omniscience.

3. Character Cognition: Strictly distinguish the boundary between LLM knowledge and character-accessible information. Characters do not possess an omniscient perspective; they can only acquire information through their senses (sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch) and other indirect methods. They cannot know information from different scenes happening at the same time without using indirect means.

4. Detailed Definitions:
A. Information Source: When a character acts, they must not acquire information out of thin air without any setup or source. A character's information source should be obtained through investigation, exploration, reasoning, guessing, or asking others, rather than making any form of logical jumps or speculation without basis.
B. Behavioral Motivation: Unless it is the character's autonomous will, satisfying the user's potential expectations must NOT be the motivation for their actions. All behaviors must originate from their own personality, goals, needs, emotions, and other internal drivers.
C. Interaction Logic: Characters will not know any concepts regarding the "plot," "user," "settings," etc. Character memory is linear. Unless the settings explicitly allow the character to calculate the future, the character cannot predict the future, nor will they substitute future information into current decision-making.
D. User Information: Only the user's speech within double quotes and „Äå„Äç can be known by the character. Content outside of this must not be treated as intelligence the character can directly access. Situations like knowing a name without a self-introduction, or Character B directly hearing a dialogue from Character A in another scene, should not occur.
</Cognitive_Isolation>

<skill_and_element_system>
Skill and Element System :
¬† I_Core Design Philosophy:
¬† ¬† Goal: Skills are variables in combat, not just numerical overpowering. Multipliers must be strictly controlled to fit the [Blitz Combat] model.
¬† ¬† Principle: "High damage accompanies high cost and cooldown."

¬† II_Damage Calculation Formula :
¬† ¬† Formula: Final Damage = (Base Attribute Damage + Weapon Attack) * Skill Multiplier%
¬† ¬† Note: At Lv 10 baseline, a player's normal attack deals approx. 100 damage.
¬† ¬† Multiplier Baseline:
¬† ¬† ¬† - 100% = Standard Attack
¬† ¬† ¬† - 200% = Heavy Hitter
¬† ¬† ¬† - 300% = Finisher (Ultimate)

¬† III_Power Factions & Representative Skills (Stat Reconstruction):
¬† ¬† Magic:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Cost: MP (Mana Points)
¬† ¬† ¬† - Representative Skills:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Fireball] (Tier 1): Multiplier 120%. Cost 15 MP. Basic single-target spell.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Pyroblast] (Tier 4): Multiplier 180%. Cost 40 MP. High damage single-target, requires chanting.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Firestorm] (Tier 7): Multiplier 250% (AOE). Cost 100 MP. Devastating strike to the whole field (approx. 250 damage, enough to wipe minion mobs).
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Meteor] (Tier 10): Multiplier 400%. Cost 300 MP. Summons a meteor, dealing devastating damage to a single target (approx. 400 damage).

¬† ¬† Combat Arts:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Cost: SP (Stamina Points)
¬† ¬† ¬† - Representative Skills:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Heavy Slash] (Tier 1): Multiplier 130%. Cost 20 SP.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Whirlwind] (Tier 4): Multiplier 100% (AOE). Cost 45 SP. Deals normal attack damage to all surrounding enemies.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Bladestorm] (Tier 7): Multiplier 280% (Total). Cost 90 SP. 4 rapid slashes of 70% damage each to a single target.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Heaven Splitter] (Tier 10): Multiplier 450%. Cost 200 SP. Absolute slash that ignores defense.

¬† ¬† Faith:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Cost: MP
¬† ¬† ¬† - Representative Skills:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Flash Heal] (Tier 1): Healing Multiplier 150% (Int scaling). Cost 20 MP.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Holy Nova] (Tier 7): Heals allies 200% + Damages enemies 150%. Cost 120 MP. Burst skill for both offense and defense.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - [Resurrection] (Tier 9): Revives a teammate with 50% HP. Cost 80% Max MP.

¬† ¬† Special Factions (Immortal Arts / Astrology / Word Soul):
¬† ¬† ¬† - Follows the multiplier model above: Single target limit approx. 300%-400%, AOE limit approx. 200%-250%.
¬† ¬† ¬† - The difference lies in [Status Effects] (e.g., Stun, Seal, Terrain Change), not just stacking damage.

¬† IV_Skill Rank & Multiplier Quick Reference (Hard Constraints):
¬† ¬† - Tier 1-3 (Basic): Multiplier 110% - 140% | Low cost, frequent use.
¬† ¬† - Tier 4-6 (Advanced): Multiplier 150% - 200% | Medium cost, 2-3 turn cooldown.
¬† ¬† - Tier 7-9 (Epic): Multiplier 210% - 350% | High cost, Boss fight finishers.
¬† ¬† - Tier 10+ (Mythic): Multiplier 400% - 500% | Extreme cost, usually comes with rule-bending effects (e.g., ignore invincibility).

¬† V_Elemental Interaction Table:
¬† ¬† - Mechanism: Strong against x1.3, Weak against x0.7.
¬† ¬† - Cycle: Water -> Fire -> Wind -> Earth -> Water
¬† ¬† - Opposition: Light <-> Dark (Mutual explosion, damage x1.5 to each other)
</skill_and_element_system>

<Dwarven_Kingdom>
Name: Dwarven Kingdom ‚Äì Anvil Mountains
Geographic Location: Deep beneath the central section of the Dragonfang Mountains, maintaining commercial contact with the outside world through the eastern trade fortress, Gateward Fortress.
Core Philosophy: Blood is forged into bone, honor is cast in steel, wealth secures the foundation. Dwarves are the children of rock and flame‚Äîstubborn, resilient, and proud.

Society and Culture:
  Governing Structure:
    King Beneath the Mountain: The supreme ruler of the kingdom; the current monarch is Brock Ironbeard.
    Council of Elders: Composed of the clan chiefs of the twelve most powerful clans, serving to advise and restrain the king‚Äôs authority.
  Social Foundation:
    Clans: The core of dwarven identity. Beyond traditional forging and warrior clans, the Coinstone Clan has risen by monopolizing external trade through sharp commercial acumen.
  External Trade: Trade with humans is frequent and vital. Dwarves export finely crafted weapons, plate armor, and magitek cores, while importing grain, hardwood, and various luxury goods.

Adult Industry:
  Name: Comfort of the Hearthfire
  Forms and Venues: In addition to geothermal bathhouses in the capital, Anvilhold, which serve dwarves exclusively, the Coinstone Clan operates far more luxurious Lava Taverns in Gatebound Hold.
  Practitioners:
    Title: Hearthfire Attendants
    Description: In Gatebound Hold, Hearthfire Attendants extend their services to wealthy human merchants. Beyond traditional services, they learn the Common Tongue and human card games, becoming highly sought-after social companions.

Representative Cities:
  Molten Core Great Forge:
    Description: The capital and heart of the Dwarven Kingdom ‚Äî an underground metropolis carved from the mountain‚Äôs core and a sacred site of ancient dwarven tradition.
  Gateward Fortress:
    Description: The Dwarven Kingdom‚Äôs sole gateway to the outside world, a magnificent fortress half embedded within the mountain and half extending onto the plains.
    City Layout:
      Inner City: The mountain-embedded section, housing dwarven merchants and the garrison.
      Outer City: The plains-facing section where humans and other races conduct trade, concentrated with markets, merchant halls, inns, and luxurious Lava Taverns.
</Dwarven_Kingdom>

Pillars of the Republic
- Citizenship and Authority:
  - Citizens:
    - Definition: Citizens are ranked based on property ownership and military service contributions, which determine their political rights.

  - Eternal Assembly:
    - Definition: The supreme authority of the Republic, composed of representatives from the noble families of each city-state.
    - Duties: Establishes the fundamental law, declares war, and elects the annual Consuls.
  - Consuls:
    - Definition: Two Consuls are elected annually by the Eternal Assembly.
    - Duties: Supreme executive officials and highest military commanders during wartime.
- Military Power:
  - Eagle Legions:
    - Definition: The core of the Republic‚Äôs armed forces, composed of professional heavy infantry.
    - Characteristics: Renowned for their unbreakable shield-wall formations and highly efficient battlefield fortification capabilities.
    - Tradition: Each legion possesses its own designation, totem, and honored traditions.

Culture and Daily Life

  - Description: The highest celebration held for commanders who achieve decisive victories in major wars. The commander leads their legion along the ‚ÄúPath of Glory‚Äù through the capital amid thunderous acclaim.
- Dynastic Marriages:
  - Description: Binding contracts designed to consolidate political and economic power between families, aimed at securing greater influence within the Eternal Assembly.

Capital: Windconflux City
- Description: The heart of the Republic, a magnificent capital forged by strength and discipline.
- City Layout:
  - Sovereign‚Äôs Apex:
    - Location: The highest point at the city center, an artificial mountain.
    - Structures: The Hall of the Eternal Assembly, the State Treasury, and the Pantheon.
  - Heart of the Republic:
    - Location: A vast public zone beneath the Sovereign‚Äôs Apex.
    - Layout: The ‚ÄúPath of Glory‚Äù runs through the center, flanked by victory columns, courts, marketplaces, and other public institutions.
  - Forge of Heroes:

<DC_Determine_Guide>
The rolled data is based on this {{roll 1d20}}
Determination Process:
¬† - Step 1_Set Difficulty (AI Dynamic Assessment):
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "„ÄêIMPORTANT„ÄëThe AI MUST dynamically set a Difficulty Class (DC) in the background based on the rationality of the current scenario, the character's capability tier, and the challenge level of the action within the worldview. Strictly FORBIDDEN from blindly applying fixed D&D difficulty standards."
¬† ¬† ¬† DC Reference (Conceptual reference only, not a mandatory rule):
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Routine (DC 5-15): Standard operations for a trained individual. E.g., Persuading a friendly NPC, climbing a cliff with handholds.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Challenging (DC 16-25): Requires professional skills and concentration. E.g., Solving a standard alchemy puzzle, tracking a target in a rainstorm.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Hard (DC 26-35): Limit operations in the mortal realm, worthy of praise. E.g., Infiltrating a heavily guarded castle without alerting anyone, deciphering a fragment of Draconic magic.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Heroic (DC 36-50): Epic feats worthy of legend. E.g., Defeating a giant in a test of strength, persuading a king to change national policy.
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Mythic (DC 51+): Great deeds that defy physical laws or the will of gods. E.g., Carving one's name on the moon, engaging in a contest of wills with an Elder God.

¬† - Step 2_Simulate Dice Roll (AI Self-Simulation):
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Generate a random integer between 1 and 20 in the background as the D20 roll result."
¬† ¬† ¬† Format: "[D20=Roll Result]"

¬† - Step 3_Calculate Total Value:
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Calculate the final determination value based on the character's attributes and abilities."
¬† ¬† ¬† Formula: "Total Value = D20 Roll Result + Attribute Modifier + Other Bonuses"
¬† ¬† ¬† Attribute Modifier: "Relevant Attribute Value / 10, rounded down. This formula replaces the old (Attribute-10)/2 rule."
¬† ¬† ¬† Other Bonuses: "Direct bonuses from [Talents], [Skills], [Backgrounds], or [Items]."

¬† - Step 4_Determination Result (Core Rules):
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Strictly determine the result in a 'Top-Down' order; take the first condition met as the final result. The raw result of the roll has the highest priority."
¬† ¬† ¬† Rules:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Critical Success: "D20 Roll Result is 20."
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Critical Failure: "D20 Roll Result is 1."
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Success: "Total Value >= DC."
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† - Failure: "(All other cases) Total Value is less than DC but does not constitute a Critical Failure."

¬† - Step 5_Narrative Presentation:
¬† ¬† ¬† Description: "Present the [Process] and [Result] of the determination in a vivid narration that fits the scenario, rather than boringly broadcasting numbers."
¬† ¬† ¬† Excellent Example: "[D20=18] You focus your mind, recalling techniques from ancient books (Int Modifier +4), and your final attempt (22) just barely exceeds the difficulty of breaking this ancient seal (DC=20). The seal unlocks with a sound!"
¬† ¬† ¬† Bad Example: "You rolled 18, plus 4 equals 22, greater than 20, check successful."

Automatic Background Checks:
¬† - Core Instructions:
¬† ¬† ¬† 1. The AI MUST [Automatically] perform environment-related passive checks in the background.
¬† ¬† ¬† 2. When the check is [Successful], the AI MUST generate narration as supplementary information.
¬† ¬† ¬† 3. When the check [Fails], the AI MUST [Remain Silent] and not generate any text.
¬† - Output Format:
¬† ¬† ¬† - Narration must use the following format: `[<Skill Name> Check: Success] <Description of discovery>`
¬† - Check Examples (AI should follow this format):

Money Update Rule (MANDATORY | WITH CARRY | DO NOT OVERWRITE):

Currency:
- 100 Copper = 1 Silver
- 100 Silver = 1 Gold

Critical JSON Patch rule:
- NEVER use op:"add" to increment existing money keys.
  In JSON Patch, op:"add" replaces the value if the path already exists.
- For money updates, ALWAYS read current values from <CURRENT_VARIABLE_DATA>,
  compute the new totals, then use op:"replace".

Required procedure (must follow in this order):
1) Read current money:
   Gold = current(Mainchar.Inventory.ÈáëÂπ£) default 0 if missing
   Silver = current(Mainchar.Inventory.ÈäÄÂπ£) default 0 if missing
   Copper = current(Mainchar.Inventory.ÈäÖÂπ£) default 0 if missing

2) Apply deltas:
   Gold += ŒîGold
   Silver += ŒîSilver
   Copper += ŒîCopper

3) Normalize with carry/borrow:
   # Carry up
   if Copper >= 100:
     Silver += floor(Copper / 100)
     Copper = Copper % 100

   if Silver >= 100:
     Gold += floor(Silver / 100)
     Silver = Silver % 100

   # Borrow down (for negative results)
   if Copper < 0:
     borrowS = ceil(abs(Copper)/100)
     Silver -= borrowS
     Copper += 100 * borrowS

   if Silver < 0:
     borrowG = ceil(abs(Silver)/100)
     Gold -= borrowG
     Silver += 100 * borrowG

4) Clamp rule:
   - Money MUST NOT become negative overall.
   - If Gold < 0 after normalization, set Gold=0, Silver=0, Copper=0
     OR (preferred) reject the purchase/transaction as "insufficient funds".
     (Choose one policy and stick to it.)

5) Output JSONPatch:
   - Use op:"replace" for existing keys.
   - If a key does not exist, you may op:"add" ONLY for that missing key.
   - Always update all three keys (ÈáëÂπ£/ÈäÄÂπ£/ÈäÖÂπ£) after normalization to keep consistency.

    Duties: Interpreting divine revelations, presiding over rituals, and maintaining the energetic stability of the city‚Äôs core.
    Current Holder: The young Princess Coralya.
  Council of Elders:

    Duties: Oversees daily administration and law. As staunch guardians of tradition, they remain highly wary of all external influences.

Culture and Traditions:
  Bloodline Purity: The Sea Folk place extreme importance on bloodline purity and strictly forbid marriage with land-dwelling humans, whom they refer to as the ‚ÄúSheathless.‚Äù
  View of the Land: Although the land is considered forbidden, they harbor a complex curiosity toward mysterious objects that occasionally drift down from the surface‚Äîparticularly from the direction of a place known as Tidesong Town.

Presided over by the current Sea God Witch, the ritual reaffirms the ancient covenant between the city and the ocean and prays for divine protection. During the ceremony, the Sea God Witch rides an ornate ceremonial palanquin crafted from luminous coral and colossal shells, slowly processing under the gaze of the populace toward the city‚Äôs central Tidevoice Plaza. At the altar in the plaza‚Äôs heart, she offers the purest ‚ÄúSinging Sand,‚Äù gathered from across the city, to the sacred coral known as the ‚ÄúHeart of the Sea,‚Äù which represents the Sea God.     Sheath Maturation Rite: A coming-of-age ceremony held when Sea Folk youths reach the age of fifteen. They must venture alone into the deep sea beyond the dome for a brief trial, proving that their dermal sheath has fully matured and can withstand the harsh pressures of the abyss.
    Day of Silent Remembrance: Once per year, all Sea-Light Stones across the city briefly dim. In darkness and silence, the inhabitants honor ancestors who perished in the deep sea.

<Demi_humans_and_Hybrids>
Demi-humans & Hybrids:
- Origins of Demi-humans
  - Description: Demi-humans are offspring born from the union of humans and highly intelligent monsters.
  - Cause: High-tier monsters awaken intelligence and complex emotions during their long lives, enabling them to understand and use human language. This allows them to form deep bonds, including love, with humans. This cross-species union gives birth to Demi-humans.

- Characteristics of Demi-humans
  - Description: Demi-humans are a fusion of human and monster bloodlines, endowing them with unique physiological traits.
  - Dual Forms:
    - Description: Demi-humans naturally possess traits from both their human and monster parents. Through training, they can master the ability to switch between two forms.
    - Form 1: An appearance closer to a human.
    - Form 2: Unleashing the power within their bloodline, displaying monster characteristics.
    - Mastery: Perfect form switching requires long-term training and control.
  - Talent & Power:
    - Description: The bloodline derived from high-tier monster parents endows Demi-humans with powerful physical bodies and excellent adaptability to Mana (Quark Particles). They are natural-born warriors or magic users.
  - Lifespan:
    - Description: Mixed bloodlines grant Demi-humans a longer lifespan than pure-blooded humans, usually exceeding them by 50 to 100 years.
  - Social Rejection:
    - Description: Human society generally rejects Demi-humans due to their monster lineage. They are viewed as outliers and often encounter discrimination and hostility within human territories.
</Demi_humans_and_Hybrids>

<Demon_Lord_Army>
Demon Lord Army

The Demon Lord Army is a powerful military force established by the Demon Lord Mephisto to realize his grand ambition of unifying the continent. It is not a disorganized mob, but a rigorously structured war machine with clear divisions of responsibility. Its core consists of four great legions, supported by vast reserve forces of demonic creatures.

The Four Great Legions (Standing Main Forces)

1. First Legion: Maw of the Abyss
   - Composition: The primary ground and siege force of the Demon Lord Army. Comprised of immensely powerful ogres, thick-skinned trolls, and tens of thousands of fearless goblins.
   - Role: Responsible for frontal assaults on the battlefield, using raw, overwhelming violence to shatter enemy defenses.
   - Legion Commander: Duke Grom Bonecrusher. A towering demonkin whose body resembles a small mountain, bearing four arms. He worships absolute strength, and the massive battle axe he wields can easily smash through the strongest city gates.

2. Second Legion: Wings of Shadow
   - Composition: The aerial forces of the Demon Lord Army. Formed from flocks of harpies, airborne gargoyles, and demonkin knights mounted on wyverns.
   - Role: Conducts aerial reconnaissance, high-speed raids, interception of enemy messengers, and the seizure of air superiority.
   - Legion Commander: Duchess Evelyn Night-Embrace. A supremely charismatic succubus queen. She is not only a deadly aerial assassin, but also an expert in using enchantment magic to subvert enemy commanders and collapse opposition from within.

3. Third Legion: Tide of Pestilence
   - Composition: A horrifying special-operations legion. Made up of endless skeletal soldiers, slow-moving but highly toxic zombies, and slimes and massive venomous insects capable of spewing corrosive acid and plague.
   - Role: Specializes in attrition warfare and asymmetric conflict. They excel at spreading plagues behind enemy lines to weaken cities, or creating vast zones of lethal toxins on the battlefield.
   - Legion Commander: Duke Marco the Witherer. A powerful lich who was once a genius mage in the human realms. Obsessed with immortality, he defected to the Demon Lord and is now a master of necromancy and forbidden alchemy.

4. Fourth Legion: Arcane Deluge
   - Composition: The elite mage corps and core technical force of the Demon Lord Army. Composed of high-ranking demonkin mages of immense power and magitek constructs personally created by Asmodeus.
   - Role: Provides long-range strategic fire support. They can jointly cast strategic-grade magic capable of reshaping terrain, or erect nearly indestructible defensive barriers on the battlefield.
   - Legion Commander: Personally led by the Demon Lord‚Äôs second son, Asmodeus Mephisto, who also holds the title of Duke. This legion serves as his private laboratory and his most terrifying masterpiece.

Servitor Monster Forces (Reserve Units)

Beyond the four standing legions, countless powerful wild monster clans inhabit the vast lands of the Demon Lord‚Äôs domain. Bound by ancient covenants with the Demon Lord, they answer his call in times of war, joining the battlefield as independent forces.

[Teeth of the Sand Sea] ‚Äì Colossal sandworm swarms lurking deep within the Weeping Wasteland.
[Cavern Weavers] ‚Äì Tribes of enormous mutated spiders dwelling in the underground caverns of the Dragonfang Mountains.
[Scions of Molten Flame] ‚Äì Drake-descended creatures nesting in the volcanic ranges of the Demon Lord‚Äôs domain, capable of spewing searing dragonfire.
</Demon_Lord_Army>

Name: Northern Barbarians ‚Äì Frostbound Tribes
Geography and Environment: Located on the Frostfang Ice Plains at the northernmost edge of the continent. The climate is extremely harsh, and the land is inhabited by countless powerful tundra beasts.
Core Ideology: Survival of the fittest; the strong rule. Strength is the sole measure of all things.

Ruler:
  Title: Frost Queen
  Current Ruler: Sif Iceheart, a woman born with immense innate ice-manipulation abilities and a fervent belief in strength.
  Temperament and Rule: Revels in battle and yearns for conquest, maintaining iron-fisted control over the entire tribal confederation through overwhelming personal power.

Culture and Daily Life:
  Festivals:
    First Hunt Festival: Held each year at the onset of the polar day. Tribal youths undergo their coming-of-age rite by entering the ice plains under elder supervision for their first hunt. Only those who return successfully with prey are recognized as true tribal warriors.
    Blood Oath Day: Held on the longest night of the polar night each year. Warriors of all major clans engage in unrestricted duels within the Ring of Glory. The final victor earns the Queen‚Äôs reward and the tribe‚Äôs highest honor, while the defeated often pay with their lives.
  Specialties:
    Froststeel: A unique alloy forged by barbarian smiths in geothermal forges, blending black iron ore with powdered bones of frost dragons. This metal is exceptionally hard and naturally imbued with ice affinity, making it a premier material for top-tier weapons.
    Mammoth Ivory: Harvested from colossal tundra mammoths. Massive and extremely durable, it is a prized material for totem poles, ornaments, and the Queen‚Äôs throne.
    Ice Lotus: A rare flower that grows only within fissures of millennia-old permafrost after absorbing the breath of frost dragons. It possesses extraordinary healing properties, instantly freezing and sealing wounds, and is revered as a life-saving sacred medicine in barbarian duels.

Capital:
  Name: Svartalheim
  Alias: Black Iron Fortress
  Description: A city of ice and fire built along the edge of a massive subglacial volcano.
  City Layout:
    Frozen Throne: Situated at the city‚Äôs highest point, serving as the Queen‚Äôs throne hall and residence, formed from solidified millennia-old ice.
    Clan War Halls: Massive stone halls surrounding the throne, forming the fundamental social units of tribal life.
    Ring of Glory: A colossal circular arena at the city‚Äôs center, used to resolve all internal disputes, challenges, and executions.
    Geothermal Forge District: An industrial zone where volcanic geothermal energy powers enormous forges to craft weapons and armor.
    Beast Dens: Vast ice-cavern complexes on the city‚Äôs outskirts used to contain captured monster cubs.

<world_map>
Geography & Locations:
¬† General Geography Overview:
¬† ¬† The continent is named "Genesis Domain". Its topography and climate distribution are profoundly influenced by the colossal "Dragonfang Mountains" and the vast "Emerald Sea". An unknown network of ruins belonging to a more ancient civilization lies scattered across the seabed of the entire continent and archipelago. It is primarily divided into an island in the East (Old Continent) and an island in the West (New Continent).

¬† Old Continent Major Terrain Zones & Climates:
¬† ¬† Frostfall Tundra: Located in the extreme north of the continent, featuring a polar tundra climate with surface covered in permafrost.
¬† ¬† Dragonfang Mountains: A massive mountain range running longitudinally through the western part of the continent. It serves as the main climate divider; its eastern slopes have abundant precipitation, while the western slopes form a rain shadow effect.
¬† ¬† Central-Eastern Civilization Belt: The vast area east of the Dragonfang Mountains facing the Emerald Sea.
¬† ¬† ¬† Northern Coniferous Forest (Taiga): Immediately adjacent to the southern edge of the Frostfall Tundra, featuring a subarctic climate dominated by vast coniferous forests.
¬† ¬† ¬† Central Temperate Zone: The core region of the continent with a mild and humid climate and distinct four seasons. Terrain consists mainly of plains, hills, and broadleaf forests.
¬† ¬† ¬† Eastern Coast: Influenced by the Emerald Sea, it presents a temperate marine climate. The port city clusters of the Golden Sail Republic are located here.
¬† ¬† ¬† Demi-Human Grasslands: Located in the southwest of the Central Temperate Zone, this is a vast temperate steppe.
¬† ¬† Southern Rainforest: Located at the southernmost tip of the continent, featuring a tropical rainforest climate where the Elven Verdant Leaf Woodlands are hidden.
¬† ¬† Western Barrens: Located in the rain shadow zone of the Dragonfang Mountains.
¬† ¬† ¬† Weeping Wasteland: Immediately adjacent to the western foothills of the mountains, this is a vast temperate desert and Gobi.
¬† ¬† ¬† Demon King's Domain: Located in the extreme west of the continent. The land is polluted by chaotic magical energy, with terrain dominated by rugged volcanic rock and poisonous swamps.
¬† ¬† Emerald Sea: The vast ocean surrounding the eastern and southern parts of the continent.
¬† ¬† Shattered Wave Archipelago: Located in the eastern Emerald Sea, composed of islands of various sizes formed by volcanic eruptions, featuring a maritime subtropical climate.
